16378 : Store Reinforcement Points for equipment? Yes. (Cost: # )) No.
16379 : Unity Concord is a system promulgated and managed by the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network.
16380 : Participating adventurers are able to receive a variety of benefits and rewards just by engaging in their everyday activities.
16381 : Unity is a catchall term that refers to the group that participants belong to.
16382 : Unity leaders are individuals who have strong ties to adventurers' activities and are sterling representatives of their home nations.
16383 : Members of the same Unity can converse with each other over great distances through the use of specialized figurines known as %.
16384 : Chat settings may be changed by selecting Status from the main menu, and choosing Unity Info under the Unity submenu.
16385 : You may not always be able to join the chat if too many players are participating at once.
16386 : Those belonging to a Unity are able to undertake special Records of Eminence objectives related to Unity Concord activities.
16387 : The three pertinent categories include shared objectives, Unity leader-specific objectives, and Wanted battle objectives.
16388 : Shared objectives may be taken regardless of which Unity you have joined. These tasks can be undertaken at any time, and change every day at midnight (JST).
16389 : Unity leader-specific objectives are tied to the Unity's eponymous leader and change each week.
16390 : Wanted objectives center around vanquishing particularly heinous foes that terrorize Vana'diel.
16391 : These objectives are of a higher caliber, and thus require currency known as Unity accolades to undertake.
16392 : Shared and leader-specific objectives provide more accolades than run-of-the-mill objectives.
16393 : Vana'diel has always been plagued by nefarious foes pillaging the landscape, but relatives of some of the more heinous ones have been spotted lately.
16394 : The A.M.A.N. has deemed it necessary to eliminate these Wanted targets, and has notified Unity members that they are of the utmost priority.
16395 : A list of these foes can be viewed at any time by selecting the appropriate subcategory under the objectives list.
16396 : Unity Concord representatives are able to provide participants with transportation to the areas where these threats can be found.
16397 : Though tackling the profane will likely require participation of your allies, the objective can be undertaken so long as at least one person has set the appropriate objective.
16398 : When you set the objective and commence the battle, the requisite number of Unity accolades will be deducted from your total.
16399 : Successful challengers will be rewarded with special rewards in addition to the normal sparks of eminence.
16400 : No Unity accolades will be charged should you commence the battle without having the appropriate objective set, but the rewards you can reap from your efforts will be limited.
16401 : You can snatch unparalleled equipment and materials from the slain corpses of Wanted targets.
16402 : An A.M.A.N. specialist versed in arcane harmonization has kindly offered to use these materials to bring out the latent potential in such pieces.
16403 : One of the Unity guides will be pleased to accept certain combinations of equipment and materials to begin the process for you.
16404 : A number of accolades is required for this service, but the precision and accuracy of her methods are without equal, and there is no worry of your equipment being destroyed.
16405 : You can use specified materials to add new attributes to equipment that has been upgraded.
16406 : Utilizing additional materials after adding an attribute can accumulate Reinforcement Points for the equipment and increase its rank.
16407 : Increasing your equipment's rank can boost its attributes, while some equipment can also have additional attributes added later.
16408 : Speak to the Unity guides after gathering the necessary materials for your equipment in order to add attributes to it or increase its rank.
16409 : The first time you add an attribute to a piece of equipment will require the use of Unity accolades.
16410 : It also requires that you first complete a specific Records of Eminence objective.
16411 : The work you request will be carried out on-site by a specially trained Unity guide.
16412 : Completing Records of Eminence objectives as part of a Unity will reward you with Unity accolades in addition to sparks of eminence.
16413 : These accolades not only serve as a symbol of prestige, but can also be exchanged for a variety of services.
16414 : Some of these services include purchasing items, securing battle zones for hunting Wanted targets, fees for strengthening equipment, and more.
16415 : Please note that you may only exchange a maximum of # accolades per week (Earth time).
16416 : You may switch Unities once during the Unity ranking tabulation period.
16417 : This is not a decision to be taken lightly, for switching Unities will cause you to forfeit any benefits you were receiving from your previous one.
16418 : This process requires a fair deal of paperwork, and the A.M.A.N. will charge you an accolade fee based on your rank.
16419 : However, your valorous deeds remain wherever you choose to go, and you will not lose any other accolades.
16420 : Rankings are decided through the combined efforts of each of the Unity's members.
16421 : The A.M.A.N. tabulates all the good deeds done during a period of time and confers benefits on a Unity for the following ranking period.
16422 : Some of these benefits include changes to Unity accolades gained and the effects of equipment earned from Wanted battles.
16423 : Yes, you read that correctly--the attributes of certain equipment will increase in line with your Unity's ranking.
16424 : On the other hand, members of a Unity that finds itself on the lower rungs will enjoy an increase in accolades and capacity points earned to help bring them up to par.
16425 : Additionally, an individual's evaluation is the sum of the accolades they have earned divided by #. A Unity's ranking is the average of all eligible members' individual evaluations.
16426 : The A.M.A.N. does not look kindly on those who only seek to siphon rewards from others' hard work, and thus only confers these boons on those who have collected at least a certain number of accolades.
16427 : Unity leaders may also join you as alter egos for a limited period of time.
16428 : Those with evaluations of # or greater will be able to call forth an alter ego of their leader to assist them in battle.
16429 : Those eligible will be able to use the alter ego from the moment they acquire the appropriate ranking level until the tabulation after the next.
16430 : A leader's alter ego grows in power the higher their Unity is ranked.

16835 : You must take on the % Records of Eminence objective before receiving the explanation.
16836 : You must complete % before taking on the % Records of Eminence objective.
16837 : What do you want to learn about? What is the Assist Channel? How can I post a message? What are the requirements? Where can I access it? Tell me about mentor messages. Where can I find mentors? What are Thumbs Up and Warnings? What happens if I am muted? When do my posting rights expire? Nothing for now.
16838 : The Assist Channel is a special chat channel that allows adventurers to ask questions and receive advice from veteran players known as mentors.
16839 : Press the space bar to bring up the text window at the bottom of the screen and type /assistj (your message) or /assiste (your message) to post your message.
16840 : You can also use /aj for /assistj, and /ae for /assiste.
16841 : Additionally, pressing CTRL+Q will display /assistj or /assiste in the text window for you.
16842 : You can change the CTRL+Q shortcut command...
16843 : ...by going to Main Menu > Config > Misc. 2 > Key Assignment > Commands > Chat: /AssistE or /AssistJ.
16844 : It is recommended that you use /assistj (/aj) when posting in Japanese, and /assiste (/ae) when posting in English.
16845 : You must meet one of the following conditions in order to post to the Assist Channel.
16846 : 1. You are a new player You may post messages from the moment you first set foot in Vana'diel.
16847 : 2. You are a returnee As a returning player, you may post messages upon logging in with a character that has not logged in for at least 48 days.
16848 : 3. You are a mentor You may post messages as long as you remain a mentor to other players.
16849 : New players and returnees may post messages until they have been logged in for a total of 48 hours since first receiving their posting rights.
16850 : If you wish to check how long you can continue to post for, speak to an  and choose "When do my posting rights expire?" to see how much time you have left.
16851 : The Assist Channel can only be used in the following areas.
16852 : Available areas: %, %, %, %, %%
16853 : ...%%%%%%%%
16854 : ...%, %, %, %, %, %, %, %...
16855 : ...%, %, %, and your Mog House (Rent-a-Room).
16856 : You cannot post or read messages outside of the areas listed above.
16857 : Even in areas where messages are allowed, you cannot post consecutive messages. Please wait a while after posting a message.
16858 : Mentor messages are accompanied by a flag () marker. This marker indicates the mentor's reliability (Mentor Class) and experience as an adventurer (Mastery Rank).
16859 : As a mentor's Mentor Class increases, the color and shape of the marker will change:  >  >
16860 : A  marker is a sign that the mentor has earned the highest levels of trust from other adventurers.
16861 : The number affixed to the marker is the mentor's Mastery Rank, and indicates how experienced the mentor is as an adventurer.
16862 : The higher the number, the more experienced the mentor is.
16863 : You can check your own Mastery Rank even if you do not serve as a mentor, so feel free to take a look every now and then if you are curious.
16864 : You can check your Mastery Rank by going to Main Menu > Status > Profile.
16865 : If you wish to speak directly to a mentor, you can search for mentors by going to Main Menu > Help Desk > Mentor Search.
16866 : The Thumbs Up feature enables you to let mentors know when their comments proved to be especially helpful.
16867 : Mentors who earn lots of Thumbs Up replies from other adventurers will see their Mentor Class increase.
16868 : Remember to give a Thumbs Up to any mentor you feel helped you out or taught you something useful.
16869 : A Warning is a feature that can only be used by mentors.
16870 : Please use this feature when a post's contents are insufficient or otherwise may be construed as harassment.
16871 : To send a Thumbs Up or Warning to another player, open the Chat Log Window and move the cursor over the relevant message and press the confirm button (Enter key) to bring up the evaluation menu.
16872 : Evaluations can be made for 10 minutes following the designated player's latest post to the Assist Channel.
16873 : You may send up to one Thumbs Up and one Warning per day (Earth time).
16874 : The Mute feature places restrictions on your ability to post, meaning that other players will be unable to see the messages you post to the Assist Channel.
16875 : Please refrain from posting unsuitable content so that the veteran adventurers are not forced to mute you.
16876 : Mute status can be removed by players that have the necessary Mute List access rights, or it will be removed automatically 24 hours (Earth time) after the mute status was enabled.
16877 : You are free to post messages to the Assist Channel until you decide to stop serving as a mentor.
16878 : You may post messages to the Assist Channel until #:# on #/#/#. (Time remaining: Approx. # [sec./min./hr.])
16879 : If you log out while you still have time available, your remaining time will be carried over to the next time you log in.
16880 : You are about to lose the ability to post messages to the Assist Channel.
16881 : You are unable to post messages to the Assist Channel.
16882 : Take on the % Records of Eminence objective from the Tutorial section of the Records of Eminence Menu and speak to the A.M.A.N. liaison.

16891 : Examine the Tales' Beginning in Port Jeuno (F-8) when you wish to start Abyssea.

16893 : Start Chains of Prromathia? Yes (View cutscene). Maybe later.
16894 : Examine the Tales' Beginning in Lower Delkfutt's Tower (H-10) when you wish to start Chains of Promathia.

16896 : Start Seekers of Adoulin? Yes (View cutscene). Maybe later.
16897 : Examine the Tales' Beginning in Northern San d'Oria, Bastok Market,s or Windurst Woods when you wish to start Seekers of Adoulin.
16898 : You are now able to enjoy a new storyline, Rhapsodies of Vana'diel.
16899 : Start Rhapsodies of Vana'diel? Yes (View cutscene). Maybe later.
16900 : Examine the Tales' Beginning in the three nations when you wish to start Rhapsodies of Vana'diel.
16901 : You are now able to enjoy a new storyline, Rise of the Zilart.
16902 : Start Rise of the zilart? Yes (View cutscene). Maybe later.
16903 : Examine the Tales' Beginning in Norg (H-9) when you wish to start Rise of the Zilart.
16904 : Would you like to start a new storyline that you previously postponed?
16905 : Start which? None for now. Rise of the Zilart. A Crystallinbe Prophecy. A Shantotto Ascension. Chains of Promathia. Abyssea. Seekers of Adoulin. Rhapsodies of Vana'diel.
16906 : Start the previously postponed storyline [Rise of the Zilart/A Crystalline Prophecy/A Shantotto Ascenaion/Chains of Promthia/Abyssea/Seekers of Adoulin/Rhapsodies of Vana'diel]?
16907 : Start the storyline? Yes, please. No, thank you.
